_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:18:39 using v2.0
title: How has the proportion of carers finding it easy to access information varied by region?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of carers who found it very or fairly easy to find information decreased by 4.7% from 2009/10 to 2012/13. London had the lowest proportion of carers (63.8%) who found it very or fairly easy to find information. This is 10.9% below the highest seen in the North East and 5.2% below the national average of 69.0%.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Personal Social Services Survey of Adult Carers in England
